intro: Chuquiraga pardoiana, commonly known as the Pardo's chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or arid soils, and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Chuquiraga pardoiana is often used in traditional medicine by local communities for its purported health benefits.
